metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4152 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Spring OXM wrapper in Spring Framework before 3.2.4 and 4.0.0.M1, whenusing the JAXB marshaller, does not disable entity resolution, which allowscontext-dependent attackers to read arbitrary files, cause a denial ofservice, and conduct CSRF attacks via an XML external entity declaration inconjunction with an entity reference in a (1) DOMSource, (2) StAXSource,(3) SAXSource, or (4) StreamSource, aka an XML External Entity (XXE) issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4152` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-beans-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-context-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-context-support-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-core-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-expression-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-instrument-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-jdbc-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-jms-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-orm-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-oxm-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-test-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-transaction-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-web-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-web-portlet-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-web-servlet-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
libspring-web-struts-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.6.RELEASE-10').
